trans-unit.source: Create an Azure RemoteApp image
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure RemoteApp image

trans-unit.source: Learn about the options available for creating images for Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Learn about the options available for creating images for Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure RemoteApp image
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure RemoteApp image

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp uses images to hold the apps that you share with your users.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp uses images to hold the apps that you share with your users.

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure RemoteApp collection with your choice of applications, whether it is cloud or hybrid, you start by creating an image with those applications installed.
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure RemoteApp collection with your choice of applications, whether it is cloud or hybrid, you start by creating an image with those applications installed.

trans-unit.source: Then, create a collection that uses that image, assign users to the collection, and publish apps to those users.
trans-unit.target: Then, create a collection that uses that image, assign users to the collection, and publish apps to those users.

trans-unit.source: You have several options for creating or using images.
trans-unit.target: You have several options for creating or using images.

trans-unit.source: The basic [requirement](remoteapp-imagereqs.md) for an image is that it run Windows Server 2012 R2 and have the Remote Desktop Session Host (RDSH) role installed.
trans-unit.target: The basic [requirement](remoteapp-imagereqs.md) for an image is that it run Windows Server 2012 R2 and have the Remote Desktop Session Host (RDSH) role installed.

trans-unit.source: How you get that is where things get interesting.
trans-unit.target: How you get that is where things get interesting.

trans-unit.source: You have the following options when it comes to images:
trans-unit.target: You have the following options when it comes to images:

trans-unit.source: You can import and use an [image based on an Azure virtual machine](remoteapp-image-on-azurevm.md).
trans-unit.target: You can import and use an [image based on an Azure virtual machine](remoteapp-image-on-azurevm.md).

trans-unit.source: This is good for line-of-business apps that require custom settings.
trans-unit.target: This is good for line-of-business apps that require custom settings.

trans-unit.source: You can customize the image to work for the app.
trans-unit.target: You can customize the image to work for the app.

trans-unit.source: You can [create and upload a custom image](remoteapp-create-custom-image.md).
trans-unit.target: You can [create and upload a custom image](remoteapp-create-custom-image.md).

trans-unit.source: This is good if you already have an image that you use for your on-premises Remote Desktop Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: This is good if you already have an image that you use for your on-premises Remote Desktop Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: You can use one of the [template images](remoteapp-images.md) included in your RemoteApp subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can use one of the [template images](remoteapp-images.md) included in your RemoteApp subscription.

trans-unit.source: These images are created and maintained by the RemoteApp team and contain some standard applications (like the Office suite) that you can make available to your users.
trans-unit.target: These images are created and maintained by the RemoteApp team and contain some standard applications (like the Office suite) that you can make available to your users.

trans-unit.source: Note that only the Office 365 Pro Plus image can be used in a production setting.
trans-unit.target: Note that only the Office 365 Pro Plus image can be used in a production setting.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of where you get your image or how you create it, you'll want to make sure you understand the [app requirements](remoteapp-appreqs.md) to ensure that your app works well in RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of where you get your image or how you create it, you'll want to make sure you understand the [app requirements](remoteapp-appreqs.md) to ensure that your app works well in RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Then, the next step is to create a [cloud](remoteapp-create-cloud-deployment.md) or [hybrid](remoteapp-create-hybrid-deployment.md) collection.
trans-unit.target: Then, the next step is to create a [cloud](remoteapp-create-cloud-deployment.md) or [hybrid](remoteapp-create-hybrid-deployment.md) collection.
